Title: Cyrus-SASL: Denial of service
Synopsis:
A NULL pointer dereference in Cyrus-SASL may allow remote attackers
    to cause a Denial of Service condition.

Background.Text: Cyrus-SASL is an implementation of the Simple Authentication and Security Layer.

Description.Text: In the GNU C Library (glibc) from version 2.17 onwards, the crypt() function call can return NULL when the salt violates specifications or the system is in FIPS-140 mode and a DES or MD5 hashed password is passed. When Cyrus-SASLâ€™s authentication mechanisms call crypt(), a NULL may be returned.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could trigger this vulnerability to cause a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.
